definition: to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly

sentences.english: There is no feeling that is too hasty to do.
sentences.chinese: 已经没有感觉了，就是做也是草草了事。

sentences.english: Many college students used to rush through their summer fieldwork projects.
sentences.chinese: 很多大学生过去常常对暑期实地调查作业草草了事。
所以别再让前戏草草了事了。

sentences.english: On hearing that her husband was ill, she balled of  that work and hurried back home.
sentences.chinese: 一听丈夫得病，她就把那项工作草草了事并赶回家去。

sentences.english: Often vowed to lose weight, but it always has been too hasty.
sentences.chinese: 每每信誓旦旦要减肥，却总是草草了事。

sentences.english: The police dismissed the incident as a "misunderstanding".
sentences.chinese: 警方把这件事作为“误会”草草了事。

sentences.english: Mary and Jack married, their wedding was a quickie.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽和杰克结婚了，他们的婚礼草草了事。

definition: to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
to work vaguely then retreat (idiom); sloppy and half-hearted/half-baked
to settle a matter by leaving it unsettled/to end up with nothing definite
to skate around/to skip over/to skimp
lit. tiger's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the classics)/perfunctory/to skimp/to botch/to do sth half-heartedly or just for show/barely enough to get by
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
